author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: julia
- I was not able to load the package (i.e. `import PolyhedralOmega` failed). See the CI logs for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

@kevseryolcu note that

1. your package doesn't have a license file: the [General registry only accepts OSI-approved licenses](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/6f67ea73e2d08b6ebbb1eed7d161ca77eed83a1f/README.md#registering-a-package-in-general)
2. the package [can't be loaded](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/28663/checks?check_run_id=1765837377):
```julia
┌ Warning: Package PolyhedralOmega does not have LinearAlgebra in its dependencies:
│ - If you have PolyhedralOmega checked out for development and have
│   added LinearAlgebra as a dependency but haven't updated your primary
│   environment's manifest file, try `Pkg.resolve()`.
│ - Otherwise you may need to report an issue with PolyhedralOmega
└ Loading LinearAlgebra into PolyhedralOmega from project dependency, future warnings for PolyhedralOmega are suppressed.
ERROR: LoadError: ArgumentError: Package PolyhedralOmega does not have IterTools in its dependencies:
- If you have PolyhedralOmega checked out for development and have
  added IterTools as a dependency but haven't updated your primary
  environment's manifest file, try `Pkg.resolve()`.
- Otherwise you may need to report an issue with PolyhedralOmega
Stacktrace:
 [1] require(into::Module, mod::Symbol)
   @ Base ./loading.jl:880
 [2] include
   @ ./Base.jl:386 [inlined]
 [3] include_package_for_output(pkg::Base.PkgId, input::String, depot_path::Vector{String}, dl_load_path::Vector{String}, load_path::Vector{String}, concrete_deps::Vector{Pair{Base.PkgId, UInt64}}, source::Nothing)
   @ Base ./loading.jl:1209
 [4] top-level scope
   @ none:1
 [5] eval
   @ ./boot.jl:360 [inlined]
 [6] eval(x::Expr)
   @ Base.MainInclude ./client.jl:446
 [7] top-level scope
   @ none:1
in expression starting at /tmp/jl_BnHGFB/packages/PolyhedralOmega/LMgAC/src/PolyhedralOmega.jl:1
ERROR: Failed to precompile PolyhedralOmega [cb40c8c0-6f69-4117-9a87-8a763eccf627] to /tmp/jl_BnHGFB/compiled/v1.6/PolyhedralOmega/jl_by50XN.
Stacktrace:
 [1] error(s::String)
   @ Base ./error.jl:33
 [2] compilecache(pkg::Base.PkgId, path::String, internal_stderr::IOContext{Base.PipeEndpoint}, internal_stdout::IOContext{Base.PipeEndpoint})
   @ Base ./loading.jl:1356
 [3] compilecache(pkg::Base.PkgId, path::String)
   @ Base ./loading.jl:1302
 [4] _require(pkg::Base.PkgId)
   @ Base ./loading.jl:1017
 [5] require(uuidkey::Base.PkgId)
   @ Base ./loading.jl:910
 [6] require(into::Module, mod::Symbol)
   @ Base ./loading.jl:897
```
3. you should have a [compat section for your dependencies](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/6f67ea73e2d08b6ebbb1eed7d161ca77eed83a1f/README.md#automatic-merging-of-pull-requests) in `Project.toml`, including Julia (but excluding standard libraries, because they follow the version in Julia itself)

[noblock]
